question: Is phospholipid hydroperoxide glutathione peroxidase a selenoprotein?
ideal_answer:
Yes,
the phospholipid hydroperoxide glutathione peroxidase (PHGPx/GPx4) is  the major selenoprotein.

snippets.text: Glutathione peroxidase (Gpx1) is the major selenoprotein in most tissues in animals.
The selenoenzyme Gpx4 is essential for early embryogenesis and cell viability for its unique function to prevent phospholipid oxidation.
the major selenoprotein expressed by germ cells in the testis, the phospholipid hydroperoxide glutathione peroxidase (PHGPx/GPx4)
